node.label: User sends a request to one of the managers. For example, run two instances of the go-demo service and one instance of the DB.
Swarm manager compares the current state of the cluster with the desired state, generates tasks, and sends them to Swarm nodes.
Swarm nodes translate received tasks to Docker Engine commands.
A user sends a request with the desired state to one of the Swarm managers.
Swarm manager gets the cluster information from the service registry, creates a set of tasks, and dispaches them to Swarm workers (managers in this context act as workers as well).
Swarm workers translate the tasks into commands and send them to the local Docker Engine which, in turn, runs or stops containers.
Swarm workers continuously monitor Docker events and update the service registry.
